bug_description:
Bug ID: 92
Project: Closure
Bug Type: SL SH SF
Test Error Message: junit.framework.AssertionFailedError

Bug Description:

The bug is located in the method "void replace()" of the Closure project. The problematic line in the code is 

    int indexOfDot = namespace.indexOf('.');

This piece of code is trying to find the index of the first occurrence of the dot character in the "namespace" variable. The issue arises when there are multiple dots in the "namespace" string as this code does not account for such a case and always returns the index of the first dot found, which can lead to incorrect program operations later on in the code. This causes the program to fail the junit test, throwing a junit.framework.AssertionFailedError.

Step-by-step guide to reproduce the bug:

1. Initialize the "namespace" variable with a string containing at least two dots.
2. Call the replace() method.
3. The bug will manifest when the code is trying to manage the case where the name was implicitly provided by two independent modules and there is requirement to move the code up to a common module.
4. Note that the indexOfDot will always be the index of the first dot because of the line int indexOfDot = namespace.indexOf('.');, which does not account for multiple dots in the string.

Fixed Code Description:

In the fixed code, 

    int indexOfDot = namespace.indexOf('.');

has been replaced by 

    int indexOfDot = namespace.lastIndexOf('.');

This line now correctly gets the index of the last dot within the "namespace" variable whenever there are multiple dots. This fix ensures that the program operates correctly when it encounters a namespace with multiple dots, thus preventing the junit.framework.AssertionFailedError from being thrown.
